text: Helen Hardacre (born May 20, 1949) is an American academic and Japanologist. At Harvard University, she is the Reischauer Professor of Japanese Religions and Society. ==Early life== Hardacre is the daughter of British historian Paul H. Hardacre. "Retired Vanderbilt professor, Paul Hardacre, passes away," Vanderbilt Hustler, June 18, 2010. Her research was supported by a Gugghenheim fellowship. ==Career== Hardacre was Director of the Edwin O. Reischauer Institute of Japanese Studies from 1995 through 1998.Reischauer Institute of Japanese Studies (RIJS), Director Her research interests focused on religion in Japan and the history of Japan.
